crypto.name: Compact
crypto.desc:
Easy

Apparently this is meant to replace the Latin alphabet??

Flag format: byuctf{word or phrase} case insensitve.

crypto.name: Poem
crypto.desc:
Medium case insensitve

epcndkohlxfgvenkzcllkoclivdckskvpkddcyoceipkvrcslkdhycbcscwcsc

Spaces and punctuation were removed :)

Flag format - byuctf{the phrase goes here} note there are spaces in the flag, no other punctuation needed.

jail.name: Builtins 1
jail.desc:
Medium

The Docker container running the jail uses python:3.12.0a6-bullseye.

Per usual, the flag is stored in ./flag.txt

jail.name: Builtins 2
jail.desc:
Hard Self-loathing

But wait it's different this time...

Per usual, the flag is stored in ./flag.txt

jail.name: a-z0-9
jail.desc:
Hard

You can't use any of the letters of the alphabet OR any numbers

OH and don't make it tooooo long

Per usual, the flag is stored in ./flag.txt

jail.name: abcdefghijklm
jail.desc:
Medium

You can't use any of the first 13 letters of the alphabet EXCEPT for the first 4 letters of your input

OH and don't make it too long

Per usual, the flag is stored in ./flag.txt

jail.name: nopqrstuvwxyz
jail.desc:
Medium

You can't use any of the last 13 letters of the alphabet EXCEPT for the first 4 letters

OH and don't make it too long

Per usual, the flag is stored in ./flag.txt

pwn.desc:
Easy

I know you really want the flag, so I'll print it out for you, but only after January 1st, 2024 :)

pwn.name: Shellcode
pwn.desc:
Medium

You'll have to make your own shellcode for this one!

pwn.name: VFS 1
pwn.desc:
Medium

I've decided that we don't virtualize things enough, so I created a virtual file system that you can run and save your secrets on. This is still in beta-testing, but let me know what you think!

pwn.name: frorg
pwn.desc:
Hard

I love arnimals like frorggies and crarbs and octurpurse

rev.name: Chain
rev.desc:
Easy/Medium

You know sometimes you just run out of ideas for challenge descriptions...

rev.name: Chicken Again
rev.desc:
Medium

We heard you guys loved chicken so much last year, we decided to give you another one!

rev.name: Ducky1
rev.desc:
Easy

I recently got ahold of a Rubber Ducky, and have started automating ALL of my work tasks with it! You should check it out!

rev.name: Ducky2
rev.desc:
Medium

Okay, turnsk out that wask too easy to decode. You skhoud definitely try thisk one now!

(Note - Ducky3 is unlocked after solving this challenge)

rev.name: Go
rev.desc:
Medium

This is the first Go binary I've ever written, so the logic shouldn't be too complex.

rev.name: RevEng
rev.desc:
Easy

See if you can find the flag!

rev.name: Sassie
rev.desc:
Hard

Don't give me that attitude! I can be sassy if I want!

rev.name: bad2
rev.desc:
Hard Im not sorry

In a BYU-only CTF held at the end of one of our semesters, I made a Python rev chall called bad. Well, my power has doubled since the last time we met!! So now I'm making bad2 😈

web.name: urmombotnetdotnetcom 1
web.desc:
Easy

During my databases class, my group and I decided we'd create a web app with the domain urmombotnetdotnet.com, and wrote the relevant code. At first glance, it looks pretty good! I'd say we were pretty thorough. But were we thorough enough??

Oh... we also forgot to make the front end :)
